column1: Binge eating is an eating disorder in which a person regularly eats unusually large amounts of food.

Things that may lead to this disorder include: - Genes, such as having close relatives who also have an eating disorder - Changes in brain chemicals - Depression or other emotions, such as feeling upset or stressed - Unhealthy dieting, such as not eating enough nutritious food or skipping meals In the U.S., binge eating is the most common eating disorder.
Women are affected as young adults while men are affected in middle age.
